message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.ST

Reasoning: 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a new family of kernels for Multi-Task Gaussian Processes (MTGPs) that improve the expressiveness and interpretability of the models. This is a core topic in machine learning, specifically in the area of Gaussian processes.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a new family of kernels for MTGPs that can model nonlinear correlations between tasks and dependencies between spectral mixtures. This is relevant to the broader field of artificial intelligence, specifically in the area of probabilistic modeling.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The paper validates the proposed kernels on three real-world experiments, which include image and video data. This suggests that the proposed kernels may have applications in computer vision and pattern recognition.
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks): The paper proposes a new family of kernels for MTGPs that can model correlations between tasks. This is relevant to the area of social and information networks, where tasks may correspond to different nodes or edges in a network.
- cs.ST (Statistics): The paper proposes a new family of kernels for MTGPs that improve the expressiveness and interpretability of the models. This is relevant to the broader field of statistics, specifically in the area of probabilistic modeling.
